snippet: The transportation secretary said there was “no excuse” for the carmaker not to comply with a law requiring it to submit reports of fatal accidents to the government.
abstract: Federal auto safety regulators say they have levied $3.5 million penalty against Ferrari because it failed to submit reports of fatal accidents to the government; automakers are required to disclose claims they receive that blame vehicle defects for serious injuries or deaths.
lead_paragraph: The transportation secretary said there was “no excuse” for the carmaker not to comply with a law requiring it to submit reports of fatal accidents to the government.

headline.main: Ferrari Fined $3.5 Million for Not Reporting Fatal Crashes
headline.print_headline: Ferrari Fined $3.5 Million; Didn’t Report Fatal Crashes
